intro: Asplenium platyneuron f. furcatum, commonly known as the forked maidenhair fern, is a variant of the common maidenhair fern, characterized by its distinctive forked fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan. The plant features delicate, finely divided, dark green fronds that are often arching or cascading in appearance. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. The fronds are typically evergreen, providing a consistent ornamental presence throughout the year.
